alert.note: Alert for Absaroka Mountains (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued November 04 at 2:01PM MDT until November 05 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 9 PM MDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Periods of heavy snow and significant blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches. The valleys of the Shoshone River and Sunlight Basin can expect 3 to 6 inches of snow. West wind gusting 50 to 65 mph above 8000 feet, especially over exposed ridges. * WHERE...Absaroka Mountains. * WHEN...From 6 PM Friday evening to 9 PM MDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility to whiteout conditions especially in open areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snow is likely to fall between late Friday evening and midday Saturday. Backcountry enthusiasts can easily become disoriented and lost. Frostbite and hypothermia can set in quickly.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
